방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Go right at the intersection.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 오른(right) appears in 오른손(right hand), 오른발(right foot). 로(with/using) appears in 버스로(by bus), 차로(by car).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Go left at the convenience store.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 왼(left) appears in 왼손(left hand), 왼발(left foot). 로(with/using) appears in 비행기로(by plane), 기차로(by train).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Where is the restroom?
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 어디(where) appears in 어디든(anywhere), 어디서(from where). 있(to exist/be) appears in 있다(to exist), 없다(to not exist).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Can I go this way?
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 길(road) appears in 길을잃다(get lost), 길을건너다(cross street), 길가(roadside), 지름길(shortcut).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Please show me the map.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 지(land) Sino-Korean 地 appears in 지역(region), 지점(location). 도(diagram) appears in 도면(blueprint), 도시(city).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: If you turn the corner, there's a cafe.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 모퉁이(corner) appears in 모퉁이를돌다(turn corner), 모서리(edge). Korean folk pronunciation from 모+퉁이.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Go left at the intersection.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 사(four) Sino-Korean 四 appears in 사계절(four seasons), 사람(person). 거리(street) appears in 삼거리(three-way), 신호등(traffic light).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Cross at the crosswalk.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 횡(cross) Sino-Korean 橫 appears in 횡선(horizontal line). 단(section) appears in 구간(section). 보도(walkway) appears in 인도(sidewalk).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Come out through exit 3.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 출(exit) Sino-Korean 出 appears in 출발(departure), 출장(business trip). 구(opening) appears in 입구(entrance), 개구(opening).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Seoul is in the northern part of Korea.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 북(north) Sino-Korean 北 appears in 북한(North Korea), 북방(northern region). 쪽(direction) appears in 남쪽(south), 동쪽(east).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Busan is in the south.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 남(south) Sino-Korean 南 appears in 남한(South Korea), 남동쪽(southeast). 쪽(direction) appears in 북쪽(north), 서쪽(west).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: The sun rises in the east.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 동(east) Sino-Korean 東 appears in 동해(East Sea), 동명(eastern section). 쪽(direction) appears in 서쪽(west), 북쪽(north).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: The sun sets in the west.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 서(west) Sino-Korean 西 appears in 서해(West Sea), 서울(Seoul). 쪽(direction) appears in 동쪽(east), 남쪽(south).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: There's a fountain in the center of the plaza.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 중(middle) Sino-Korean 中 appears in 중간(middle), 중앙정부(central government). 앙(center) appears in 중앙선(center line).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: There's a cafe at the end of this street.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 끝(end) appears in 끝나다(to finish), 끝부분(final part), 막다(to stop). Opposite of 처음(beginning).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: I'll explain again from the beginning.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 처음(beginning) appears in 처음부터(from the start), 처음이다(it's the first time). Opposite of 끝(end).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: The pharmacy is on the opposite side of the street.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 반대(opposite) Sino-Korean 反對 appears in 반대하다(to oppose), 반대말(opposite word). 쪽(side) appears in 왼쪽(left), 오른쪽(right).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Please go up the stairs.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 계(steps) Sino-Korean 階 appears in 계층(social class), 계급(rank). 단(level) appears in 단계(stage), 층(floor).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: The elevator is broken.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: English loanword 'elevator.' Korean pronunciation: 엘리베이터. Casual: 엘베. Common with motion verbs: 타다(ride), 내리다(get off).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Take the escalator to this floor.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: English loanword 'escalator.' Korean: 에스컬레이터. Also used as: 타다(ride), 내려가다(go down). Common in 지하철(subway), 백화점(department store).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Is there a bank nearby?
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 근(near) Sino-Korean 近 appears in 근간(foundation), 근무(work). 처(place) appears in 곳(place), 장소(location).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: The cafe is on the first floor.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: One + 층(floor). 층(floor) appears in 2층(second floor), 지하1층(basement). Korean uses American system: 1층=ground floor.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: We have to go around because of construction.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 돌다(to turn) appears in 돌(around), 돈다(turns). 아(direction marker) + 가다(to go). Conjugation: 돌아가요, 돌아갔어요.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: If you pass the bank, you'll see the school.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 지나다(to pass) appears in 지나(past), 지나온(gone by). 가다(to go) appears in 간다(goes). Conjugation: 지나가요, 지나갔어요.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Just follow this road.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 따르다(to follow) appears in 따라(according to), 따라서(therefore). 가다(to go) appears in 갔어요(went). Useful for directions: follow along.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Please cross at the crosswalk.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 건너다(to cross) appears in 건너(across), 건너편(opposite). 가다(to go) appears in 간다(goes). Conjugation: 건너가요, 건너갔어요.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Turn right at the next corner.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 돌다(to turn) appears in 돌아(around), 한바퀴돌다(go around once), 돌기(circumference). Conjugation: 돌아요, 돌았어요.

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Please place it horizontally.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 가로(width) Sino-Korean influenced: 가(cross) + 로(direction). Related: 가로등(street lamp), 세로(vertical).

방향 & 위치 (Directions).example_en: Please stand it up vertically.
방향 & 위치 (Directions).notes: 세로(vertical) Korean word: 세(stand) + 로(direction). Related: 가로(horizontal), 세로로(vertically). Opposite concept of 가로.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: This store is really good.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 가게(store) appears in 편의점(convenience store), 가게주인(store owner). Related: 가게를열다(open a store).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: There are a lot of items.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 물(water/thing) appears in 물건(item), 물품(goods). 건(matter/thing) appears in 건설(construction), 건강(health).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Let's go buy a gift.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 사다(to buy) appears in 사료(feed), 사주다(to buy for). Conjugation: 사요(present), 샀어요(past). ~(으)러가다=to go in order to.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: What do they sell here?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 팔다(to sell) appears in 팔아요(sell), 팔리다(be sold). ㄹ irregular: drops before ㄴ, ㅂ. Related: 팔다(to sell), 팔리다(to sell well).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: The price is a bit expensive.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 가(price) Sino-Korean 價 appears in 가치(value), 가격표(price tag). 격(level) appears in 수격(level), 등급(grade).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: How much is this?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 얼마(how much) appears in 얼마나(how much/how), 얼마짜리(how much-priced). Essential shopping phrase - point at item.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: It's too expensive. Please give me a discount.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 비싸다(expensive) appears in 비싸요(it's expensive), 비쌌어요(was expensive). Conjugation: 비싸요, 비쌌어요. Opposite: 싸다.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: This place is really cheap!
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 싸다(cheap) appears in 싸요(it's cheap), 쌌어요(was cheap). Also means 'to wrap.' Collocation: 싸게사다(buy cheaply). Opposite: 비싸다.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Is it on discount?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 할(reduce) Sino-Korean 割 appears in 할인하다(to discount), 할인율(discount rate). 인(reduce) appears in 인하(reduction).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Is there a sale now?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: English loanword 'sale.' Korean: 세일. Used with: 기간(period), 행사(event). Common: 세일 가격(sale price), 세일 상품(sale item).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I'd like to exchange the size.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 바꾸다(to exchange) appears in 바꿀게(I'll change), 바꿨어요(changed). General word for 'change/switch/replace.' Conjugation: 바꿔요, 바꿨어요.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Can I get a refund?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 환(return) Sino-Korean 還 appears in 환불받다(receive refund), 환불조건(refund condition). 불(pay) appears in 지불(payment).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Is an exchange possible?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 교(exchange) Sino-Korean 交 appears in 교환가능(exchangeable), 교환기간(exchange period). 환(swap) appears in 환불(refund).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Do you have a different size?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: English loanword 'size.' Korean: 사이즈. Used with: 프리사이즈(free size/one size), 사이즈표(size chart). Essential for clothing shopping.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example: 이거 좀 커요. 작은 거 있어요?
쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: This is a bit big. Do you have a small one?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 크다(big) appears in 커요(it's big), 컸어요(was big). Modifier form: 큰(big). Related: 크기(size), 대형(large).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: This one is too small.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 작다(small) appears in 작아요(it's small), 작았어요(was small). Modifier form: 작은(small). Related: 작아지다(get smaller).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Do you have other colors?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 색(color) appears in 색깔(color), 색조(color tone). 깔(color nuance) appears in 색깔, 물들다(to be colored). Common: 무슨색(what color).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Please give me the red one.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 빨간(red) appears in 빨개요(it's red), 빨갛다(to be red). 색(color) appears in 파란색(blue), 검은색(black).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: The blue one is prettier.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 파란(blue) appears in 파래요(it's blue), 파랗다(to be blue). 색(color) appears in 빨간색(red), 노란색(yellow).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Do you have black pants?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 검은(black) appears in 검어요(it's black), 까만색(deep black). 색(color) appears in 흰색(white), 회색(gray).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: The white one looks the cleanest.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 하얀(white) appears in 하얘요(it's white), 흰색(white). 색(color) appears in 검은색(black), 회색(gray).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I'll pay by card. Here you go.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 카드(card) loanword from English. 로(with/by) appears in 버스로(by bus), 차로(by car). Standard payment phrase in stores.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I'll pay cash. Do you have change?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 현금(cash) Sino-Korean 現金 appears in 현금자동입출금기(ATM). 로(with) appears in 은행으로(to bank). Some stores offer cash discounts.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Do you need a bag?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 봉투(bag) appears in 비닐봉투(plastic bag), 봉투요금(bag charge). Cost in Korea: usually 50-100won. Bring your own bag to save.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Receipt, please. I need to submit it to my company.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 영수증(receipt) Sino-Korean 領收證 appears in 영수증발급(issue receipt). Keep for returns and tax deductions.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Can I try on this dress?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 입다(to wear clothes) appears in 입어봐요(try on), 입고있어요(wearing). 봐도(also try) appears in 봐요(see). Essential shopping question.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Excuse me, how much is this?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 이거(this) appears in 이거다(this is it), 이거요(this one). 얼마(how much) appears in 얼마예요(how much). Point at item while asking.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example: 좀 깎아 주세요. 두 개 살게요.
쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Please give a discount. I'll buy two.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 깎다(to cut/discount) appears in 깎아요(cut), 깎였어요(was cut/discounted). Use only at 전통시장(traditional market), NOT chain stores.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example: 마음에 안 들어요. 다른 거 있어요?
쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I don't like it. Do you have something else?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 다른(different/other) appears in 다르다(to be different), 달라요(different). Polite way to ask for alternatives.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I bought new shoes.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 신(to wear shoes) appears in 신어요(put on shoes), 신었어요(wore). 발(foot) appears in 발가락(toe), 발바닥(sole).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: There are a lot of pretty clothes.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 옷(clothes) appears in 옷가게(clothing store), 옷을입다(wear clothes). Related: 옷걸이(clothes hanger), 의류(apparel).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: These pants are comfortable.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 바지(pants) appears in 청바지(jeans), 반바지(shorts), 레깅스(leggings). Always plural in meaning. Verb: 입다(wear pants).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: The skirt is too short.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 치마(skirt) appears in 미니치마(mini skirt), 긴치마(long skirt). Related: 치마폭(skirt width). Verb: 입다(wear skirt).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: You look cooler when you wear a hat.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 모자(hat) appears in 야구모자(baseball cap), 모자를쓰다(wear hat). Note: 쓰다(wear) for hats/glasses, not 입다(wear clothes).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: The bag is heavy.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 가방(bag) appears in 책가방(school bag), 핸드백(handbag). Related: 가방을메다(carry bag), 배낭(backpack).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: These days I do a lot of online shopping.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 온라인(online) Sino-Korean + loanword. 쇼핑(shopping) loanword from English. Korea is major online shopping market.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: How long does delivery take?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 배(distribute) Sino-Korean 配 appears in 배송비(shipping cost), 배송중(in transit). 송(send) appears in 송신(transmission).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: It's free shipping for orders over 30,000 won.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 무료(free) Sino-Korean 無料 appears in 무료표본(free sample), 무료체험(free trial). 배송(delivery) appears in 배송비(shipping fee).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: The package arrived.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 택(entrust) Sino-Korean 託 appears in 탁송(consignment shipping). 배(deliver) appears in 배송(delivery). Korean's main parcel system.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I ordered it online.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 주(order) Sino-Korean 注 appears in 주문서(order form), 주문접수(order reception). Works for restaurants and shopping.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I put it in the shopping cart.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 장(market) appears in 장(market), 장보다(to shop). 바구니(basket) appears in 바구니(basket). Used for both physical and online carts.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I'll pay by card.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 결(settle) Sino-Korean 決 appears in 결제하다(to pay), 결제완료(payment complete). 제(pay) appears in 지제(payment), 결제수단(payment method).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Can I pay by credit card?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 신용(credit) Sino-Korean 信用 appears in 신용등급(credit rating), 신용조회(credit check). 카드(card) from English. High usage in Korea.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: You need to have a balance for a debit card.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 체크(check) from English 'check.' 카드(card) from English. Draws from bank account directly. Popular with younger Koreans.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: I'll collect the points.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 포인트(points) from English 'points.' 적립(accumulate) Sino-Korean. Used for: 포인트사다(buy with points), 포인트적립(earn points).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: If you have a coupon, you get a discount.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 쿠폰(coupon) from English 'coupon.' 모바일쿠폰(mobile coupon) very common. Apps like 쿠팡 offer digital coupons.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: The size doesn't fit so I'd like to exchange it.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 교환(exchange) Sino-Korean 交換 appears in 교환가능(exchangeable), 교환기간(exchange period). Conjugation: 교환해요, 교환했어요.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Returns are possible within seven days.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 반(return) Sino-Korean 返 appears in 반품하다(to return), 반품기간(return period). 품(goods) appears in 품질(quality), 신상품(new product).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: This is a defective item. Please exchange it.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 불량(defective) Sino-Korean 不良 appears in 불량식품(defective food), 불량청소년(delinquent youth). 품(product) appears in 반품(return).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: It sold out quickly because it was popular.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 품(goods) Sino-Korean 品 appears in 품질(quality), 신상품(new product). 절(cut off) appears in 절약(saving), 자절(self-control).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: New arrivals came out today.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 신(new) Sino-Korean 新 appears in 신년(new year), 신문(newspaper). 상품(product) appears in 상품권(gift certificate), 상품명(product name).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: It's much cheaper if you buy it secondhand.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 중(middle) Sino-Korean 中 appears in 중고가(mid-range price), 중소기업(small business). 고(old) appears in 낡다(to be old), 구식(old-fashioned).

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: What brand do you like?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 브랜드(brand) from English 'brand.' Used with: 명품브랜드(luxury brand), 국산브랜드(Korean domestic brand). Luxury shopping is popular.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: These pants don't fit.
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 안(not) appears in 안맞다(not fit), 안되다(can't). 맞다(to fit) appears in 맞춤(custom-made), 딱맞다(perfect fit). Common phrase.

쇼핑 (Shopping).example_en: Do you have this T-shirt in other colors?
쇼핑 (Shopping).notes: 다른(other) appears in 다르다(to be different), 달라요(it's different). 색(color) appears in 색깔(color), 색상(hue). Common shopping question.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The weather is really nice today.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 날(day) appears in 날짜(date), 날씨(weather). 씨(kind/type) appears in 씨(seed), 것(thing). Everyday conversation: 날씨 좋아요(nice weather).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: It's too hot in summer.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 덥다(hot, weather) appears in 더워요(it's hot), 더웠어요(was hot). Different from 뜨겁다(hot to touch). Conjugation: 더워요, 더웠어요.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: It's really cold outside today.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 춥다(cold, weather) appears in 추워요(it's cold), 추웠어요(was cold). For cold objects/drinks use 차갑다. Conjugation: 추워요, 추웠어요.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: When spring comes, the weather is warm.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 따뜻하다(warm) appears in 따뜻해요(it's warm), 따뜻했어요(was warm). Describes weather, clothing, personality. Conjugation: 따뜻해요, 따뜻했어요.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The breeze is refreshing.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 시원하다(cool) appears in 시원해요(it's cool), 시원했어요(was cool). Also 'refreshing' for drinks/breeze. Opposite: 덥다(hot).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: It's raining a lot, so I need an umbrella.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 비(rain) appears in 비오다(to rain), 빗소리(sound of rain). Also 빗(comb) in different context. 비를맞다=get rained on.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: It will rain tomorrow.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 비(rain) appears in 비오는(raining), 빗방울(raindrop). 오다(to come) appears in 와요(it comes). Literally: 'rain comes.'

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The first snow has fallen!
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 눈(snow) appears in 눈이오다(to snow), 첫눈(first snow). Also 눈(eye) - context makes it clear. Cultural: snow is special!

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: It snows a lot in winter.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 눈(snow) appears in 눈소식(news of snow), 눈사람(snowman). 오다(to come) appears in 와요(comes). Alternative: 눈이내리다(snow falls).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The wind is blowing hard today.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 바람(wind) appears in 바람이불다(wind blows), 바람피다(to cheat). Also means 'wish/hope.' Related: 강한바람(strong wind).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: A cool breeze is blowing on the mountain.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 불다(to blow) appears in 불어요(blows), 촛불(candle flame). Also: 촛불을불다(blow out candles). Collocation: 강한바람(strong wind).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The sky is clear so I feel good.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 맑다(clear) appears in 맑아요(it's clear), 맑았어요(was clear). For clear sky: 맑은날씨(clear weather). Conjugation: 맑아요, 맑았어요.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The sky is cloudy today.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 흐리다(cloudy) appears in 흐려요(it's cloudy), 흐렸어요(was cloudy). Also means 'blurry/dim.' Conjugation: 흐려요, 흐렸어요.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: There are many clouds so the sun isn't visible.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 구름(cloud) appears in 구름이끼다(clouds gather), 구름이걷히다(clouds clear). Related: 흰구름(white clouds), 먹구름(dark clouds).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: There was a lot of fog this morning.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 안개(fog) appears in 안개가끼다(fog sets in), 안개속(in fog). Also appears in 황사(yellow dust), 스모그(smog).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: A typhoon is coming, so we need to be careful.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 태(great) Sino-Korean 大 appears in 태풍(typhoon), 태양(sun). 풍(wind) appears in 바람(wind). Korea experiences typhoons in late summer.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: I didn't bring an umbrella so I got rained on.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 우(rain) appears in 우산(umbrella), 우비(raincoat). 산(umbrella) appears in 우산(umbrella). 비를맞다=get rained on. Collocation: 우산을쓰다(carry umbrella).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: During the rainy season, it rains every day.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 장(long) Sino-Korean 長 appears in 장마철(rainy season), 장시간(long time). 마(horse) appears in 마(horse), 기마(horseback). June-July in Korea.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: In spring, many flowers bloom.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 봄(spring) appears in 봄날씨(spring weather), 봄방학(spring vacation). Related: 벚꽃(cherry blossoms). March-May in Korea.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: I want to go to the sea in summer.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 여름(summer) appears in 여름방학(summer vacation), 여름철(summer season). Related: 수박(watermelon). June-August, hot and humid.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: In autumn, the fall foliage is really beautiful.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 가을(autumn) appears in 가을날씨(autumn weather), 가을방학(fall break). Related: 단풍(autumn leaves). September-November.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: In winter, you have to wear warm clothes.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 겨울(winter) appears in 겨울방학(winter vacation), 겨울옷(winter clothes). Related: 눈(snow). December-February, very cold.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: Today the temperature is 30 degrees.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 온(warmth) Sino-Korean 溫 appears in 온도(temperature), 온열(warmth). 도(degree) appears in 각도(angle), 진도(richter scale).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: It's too humid in summer.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 습(damp) Sino-Korean 濕 appears in 습도(humidity), 습기(moisture). 하다(to be) appears in 춥다(cold), 덥다(hot). Conjugation: 습해요, 습했어요.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: In winter, the air is dry.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 건조(dry) Sino-Korean 乾燥 appears in 건조기(dryer), 피부건조(dry skin). 하다(to be) appears in 춥다(cold). Conjugation: 건조해요, 건조했어요.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The fine dust is bad, so I wear a mask.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 미세(fine) Sino-Korean 微細 appears in 미세한(minute), 미세구조(microstructure). 먼지(dust) appears in 먼지(dust), 황사(yellow dust).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The weather forecast said it will be clear tomorrow.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 일기(weather) Sino-Korean 日氣 appears in 일기예보(weather forecast), 일기장(diary). 예보(forecast) appears in 예측(prediction).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: When the sun rises, the weather gets warm.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 해(sun) appears in 해가뜨다(sun rises), 해가지다(sun sets). Also 해(year). Related: 일출(sunrise), 일몰(sunset).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The moon is really bright tonight.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 달(moon) appears in 달이뜨다(moon rises), 보름달(full moon). Also 달(month). Cultural: 한가위(harvest festival) celebrates full moon.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: You can see many stars in the countryside.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 별(star) appears in 별을보다(watch stars), 별똥별(shooting star). Also 별(celebrity). Related: 유명한별(famous celebrity).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: A sudden rain shower came.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 소나기(rain shower) appears in 소나기가내리다(sudden rain falls). Brief, often heavy rain. Also title of famous Korean short story.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The sound of thunder is scary.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 천둥(thunder) Sino-Korean 天雷 appears in 천둥이치다(thunder strikes). Often paired with 번개(lightning). Collocation: 천둥과번개(thunder and lightning).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: Lightning flashed.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 번개(lightning) appears in 번개가치다(lightning strikes), 번쩍(flash). 번쩍(onomatopoeia). Related: 낙뢰(lightning strike, formal).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The car got damaged because hail fell.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 우박(hail) Sino-Korean influenced appears in 우박이내리다(hail falls). Frozen precipitation that damages vehicles and crops.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The drought is severe this year.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 가물다(to be dry) appears in 가뭄(drought), 가뭄이들다(drought sets in). Related: 가뭄피해(drought damage).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: Frost settled in the morning.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 서리(frost) appears in 서리가내리다(frost settles), 서릿발(frost crystals). Late autumn and early winter phenomenon.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: Dew has formed on the grass blades.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 이슬(dew) appears in 이슬이맺히다(dew forms), 이슬비(drizzle). Related: 아침이슬(morning dew, poetic reference).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The heat wave is intense this summer.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 무(intensifier) appears in 무더위(heat wave), 무더운(sweltering). 더위(heat) appears in 한더위(severe heat). 폭염(formal news term).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example: 한파가 와서 영하 이십 도까지 내려갔어요.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: A cold wave came and it dropped to minus twenty degrees.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 한(cold) Sino-Korean 寒 appears in 한파(cold wave), 한가위(harvest festival). 파(wave) appears in 파도(ocean wave), 기(기다리다 wave).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The yellow dust was bad so I wore a mask.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 황(yellow) Sino-Korean 黃 appears in 황색(yellow color), 황금(gold). 사(sand) appears in 모래(sand), 사막(desert).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The wind chill temperature is minus ten degrees.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 체감(perceived) Sino-Korean 體感 appears in 체감온도(wind chill), 체감(feeling). 온도(temperature) appears in 최고기온(daily high).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: Today's high temperature is thirty-five degrees.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 최고(highest) Sino-Korean 最高 appears in 최고(best), 최고가(highest price). 기온(air temperature) appears in 최저기온(daily low).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: Tomorrow's low temperature is minus five degrees.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 최저(lowest) Sino-Korean 最低 appears in 최저가(lowest price). 기온(air temperature) appears in 최고기온(daily high). Dawn/early morning.

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: The temperature dropped suddenly.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 기(air) Sino-Korean 氣 appears in 기온(temperature), 기후(climate). 온(warmth) appears in 온도(temperature), 온열(warmth).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: In winter it drops below zero.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 영(zero) Sino-Korean 零 appears in 영상(above zero). 하(below) Sino-Korean 下 appears in 아래(below), 하강(descent).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: During the day it goes up to five degrees above zero.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 영(zero) Sino-Korean 零 appears in 영하(below zero). 상(above) Sino-Korean 上 appears in 위(above), 상승(rise).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: I went to the beach to see the sunrise.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 일(sun) Sino-Korean 日 appears in 일몰(sunset), 일기예보(weather forecast). 출(come out) appears in 출발(departure), 출구(exit).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: Sunset time is getting earlier.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 일(sun) Sino-Korean 日 appears in 일출(sunrise), 일기(weather). 몰(sink) appears in 물다(to drown). Related: 노을(sunset glow).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: Let's rest in the shade.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 그늘(shade) appears in 나무그늘(tree shade), 그늘이지다(shade falls). Collocation: 시원한그늘(cool shade).

날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).example_en: It's warm if you sit in the sunny spot.
날씨 & 계절 (Weather & Seasons).notes: 양(sun) Sino-Korean 陽 appears in 양지(sunny spot), 양쪽(both sides). 지(land) appears in 음지(shady spot), 지역(region).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: My head hurt so I took medicine.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: '머' appears in 나머지(the rest / remainder), 할머니(grandmother), 시어머니(mother-in-law (husband's mother)). '리' appears in 요리사(chef / cook), 마리(counter for animals), 며느리(daughter-in-law).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I wash my face in the morning.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: '얼' appears in 얼마나(how much/how long), 얼마예요?(how much?), 이거 얼마예요?(how much is this?).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: My eyes are tired so I want to rest a bit.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: '눈' appears in 눈이 오다(to snow), 눈치(nunchi (social awareness).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I caught a cold and my nose is stuffed.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: '코' appears in 코스요리(course meal), 코끼리(elephant), QR코드(QR code).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: Please open your mouth wide.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: '입' appears in 입어 봐도 돼요?(can I try it on?), 입구(entrance), 입다(to wear (clothes)).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example: 음악을 너무 크게 들으면 귀가 아파요.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: If you listen to music too loud, your ears hurt.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: '귀' appears in 귀엽다(cute), 까마귀(crow), 귀걸이(earrings).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I brush my teeth three times a day.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: '이' appears in 좋은 아침이에요(good morning), 새해 복 많이 받으세요(happy new year), 오랜만이에요(long time no see). '/' appears in 뭐/무엇(what), 자동차/차(car), TV/텔레비전(television). 치(治) appears in 김치(kimchi), 치킨(fried chicken), 김치찌개(kimchi stew). '아' appears in 괜찮아요(it's okay / I'm fine), 괜찮아요(it's okay / I'm fine / no worries), 아니요(no), 좋은 아침이에요(good morning).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: My throat hurts so I can't talk.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: '목' appears in 목요일(Thursday), 골목(alley / narrow street), 목마르다(thirsty).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: If you use the computer for a long time, your shoulders hurt.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: '어' appears in 알겠어요(I understand / got it), 모르겠어요(I don't know), 모르겠어요(I don't know / I'm not sure), 수고하셨어요(good work / thanks for your effort). '깨' appears in 깨끗하다(clean).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I exercised a lot so my arms hurt.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: 팔(臂) appears in 팔다(to sell), 팔다(to sell), 팔로우(follow (on social media)).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I wash my hands before eating.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: '손' appears in 손자(grandson), 손녀(granddaughter), 손가락(finger).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I cut my finger while cooking.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: '손' appears in 손자(grandson), 손녀(granddaughter), 손(hand). '가' appears in 안녕히 가세요(goodbye (to person leaving)), 가수(singer), 가수(singer). '락' appears in 젓가락(chopsticks), 숟가락(spoon), 머리카락(hair (strands)).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: When I exercise, my chest pounds.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: '가' appears in 안녕히 가세요(goodbye (to person leaving)), 가수(singer), 가수(singer). '슴' appears in 사슴(deer).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I'm hungry. Let's go eat!
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: '배' appears in 건배(cheers (toast)), 배우(actor / actress), 배우(actor / actress).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: If you sit for a long time, your back hurts.
몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).notes: '등' appears in 신호등(traffic light), 등산(hiking), 등산(hiking).

몸 & 건강 (Body & Health).example_en: I hurt my lower back lifting something heavy.
