취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).notes: '캐' appears in 스캐너(scanner), 캐리어(suitcase), 뉴스캐스터(news anchor). '스' appears in 스물(twenty — Native Korean), 주스(juice), 아이스크림(ice cream). '트' appears in 퍼센트(percent), 세트 메뉴(set menu / combo), 디저트(dessert).

취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).example_en: I read webtoons during lunchtime. They're fun.
취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).notes: Korean innovation: digital comics for vertical phone scrolling. Platforms: 네이버 웹툰(Naver Webtoon), 카카오 웹툰(Kakao Webtoon). Many K-dramas based on webtoons.

취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).example_en: I read a lot of comics when I was young.
취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).notes: '만' appears in 잠깐만요(just a moment), 잠깐만요(just a moment), 만나서 반갑습니다(nice to meet you), 또 만나요(see you again). 화(畫) appears in 화요일(Tuesday), 영화관(movie theater), 영화관(movie theater).

취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).example_en: I volunteer every weekend. It's rewarding.
취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).notes: '자' appears in 자매(sisters), 손자(grandson), 과자(snack / cookie / cracker). 원(園) appears in 회사원(office worker / company employee), 회사원(office worker), 원(Korean won (currency unit)). '봉' appears in 봉투(bag / plastic bag), 연봉(annual salary), 봉사(volunteer work). 사(師) appears in 감사합니다(thank you (formal)), 식사하셨어요?(have you eaten?), 회사원(office worker / company employee).

취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).example_en: I play badminton with friends every weekend.
취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).notes: '배' appears in 건배(cheers (toast)), 배우(actor / actress), 배우(actor / actress). '드' appears in 카드(card), 카드(card), 카드로 할게요(I'll pay by card). '민' appears in 비타민(vitamin), 민망하다(awkward), 시민(citizen). '턴' appears in 인턴(intern).

취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).example_en: I play table tennis at the office during lunch.
취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).notes: '탁' appears in 부탁합니다(please / I ask of you / I request), 세탁소(laundromat / dry cleaner), 세탁기(washing machine). '구' appears in 누구(who), 구(nine (9) — Sino-Korean), 출구(exit).

취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).example_en: I recently started learning golf.
취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).notes: '골' appears in 골목(alley / narrow street), 골(goal). '프' appears in 아프다(to hurt), 아프다(sick), 번지점프(bungee jumping).

취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).example_en: I play tennis twice a week.
취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).notes: '테' appears in 필라테스(pilates), 프레젠테이션(presentation), 테이프(tape). '니' appears in 감사합니다(thank you (formal)), 죄송합니다(sorry (formal)), 아니요(no). '스' appears in 스물(twenty — Native Korean), 주스(juice), 아이스크림(ice cream).

취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).example_en: I want to try running a marathon next year.
취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).notes: '마' appears in 고마워요(thanks (casual)), 마흔(forty — Native Korean), 마리(counter for animals). '라' appears in 뭐라고요?(what did you say? / pardon?), 나라(country), 라면(ramyeon (Korean instant noodles)).

취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).example_en: I tried riding a yacht in Jeju.
취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).notes: '요' appears in 안녕하세요(hello), 안녕히 가세요(goodbye (to person leaving)), 안녕히 계세요(goodbye (to person staying)). '트' appears in 퍼센트(percent), 세트 메뉴(set menu / combo), 디저트(dessert).

취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).example_en: I'm going to get my diving certification this summer.
취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).notes: '다' appears in 감사합니다(thank you (formal)), 죄송합니다(sorry (formal)), 실례합니다(excuse me (formal)). '이' appears in 좋은 아침이에요(good morning), 새해 복 많이 받으세요(happy new year), 오랜만이에요(long time no see). '빙' appears in 더빙(dubbing).

취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).example_en: I can't do bungee jumping because it's scary.
취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).notes: '번' appears in 번(counter for times/occurrences), 이번 주(this week), 번개(lightning). 지(地) appears in 잘 지내요?(how are you? / are you doing well?), 실례지만(excuse me but / pardon me but), 나머지(the rest / remainder). '점' appears in 점심(lunch / noon), 편의점(convenience store), 편의점(convenience store). '프' appears in 아프다(to hurt), 아프다(sick), 골프(golf).

취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).example_en: I go rafting with friends in the summer.
취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).notes: '래' appears in 오래(for a long time), 아래(below / down), 노래(song). '프' appears in 아프다(to hurt), 아프다(sick), 골프(golf). '팅' appears in 소개팅(blind date (set up by friends)), 파이팅(fighting / you can do it), 스케이팅(skating).

취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).example_en: Riding the zipline was such a thrill!
취미 & 여가 (Hobbies & Leisure).notes: '라' appears in 뭐라고요?(what did you say? / pardon?), 나라(country), 라면(ramyeon (Korean instant noodles)). '인' appears in 장인(father-in-law (wife's father)), 할인(discount), 온라인 쇼핑(online shopping).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm really happy because I passed the exam.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: ㅡ irregular: 기쁘다 → 기쁘어요.  Specific happiness tied to a reason or event

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm happy when I'm with my family.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 행 appears in 행복(happiness), 행운(luck), 행동(action). 복 appears in 복잡하다(complicated), 행복(happiness), 복원(restoration).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: This movie is so sad.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: ㅡ irregular: 슬프다 → 슬프어요.  Often used with 너무 (so, too much) for emphasis

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example: 친구가 약속을 안 지켜서 화가 나요.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm angry because my friend didn't keep the promise.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 화(火) means fire/anger; 화가 나다 vs 화내다 (to direct anger at someone). Related: 짜증나다 (annoyed), 열받다 (slang).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: It's scary to walk alone at night.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: ㅂ irregular: 무섭 → 무어요.  무섭다 (it is scary) vs 겁나다 (I'm afraid)

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I was surprised because there was a sudden loud sound.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Past tense 놀랐어요 is very common. 깜짝 놀라다 (to be startled). Related: 깜짝, 놀라워하다.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I sometimes feel lonely because I live alone.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: ㅂ irregular: 외롭 → 외어요.  외로움 (noun: loneliness)

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm bored because I have nothing to do.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Very casual/everyday word for minor boredom. 지루하다 is formal boredom. Collocations: 심심하면, 심심한 시간.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm worried because I have an interview tomorrow.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 정 appears in 동정하다(pity), 정보(information), 정신(mind).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I always get nervous before presentations.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 긴 appears in 긴장(tension), 긴(long). 장 appears in 긴장(tension), 장소(place), 장점(advantage).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I feel embarrassed singing in front of people.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: ㅂ irregular: 부끄럽 → 부끄어요.  Can mean social shyness or momentary embarrassment

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm proud because my son studies hard.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: ㅂ irregular: 자랑스럽 → 자랑스어요.  자랑하다 (to brag)

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I was touched after hearing that story.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 감 appears in 감동(emotion/moved), 감사(thanks), 감각(sense). 동 appears in 동정하다(pity), 동료(colleague), 동의(agreement).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I was a bit disappointed after seeing the results.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 실 appears in 실망(disappointment), 실수(mistake), 실패(failure). 망 appears in 민망하다(awkward), 망원경(telescope).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm tired because I worked a lot today.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 피 appears in 피곤(tired), 피해(damage), 피부(skin). 곤 appears in 피곤(tired), 곤란(difficulty).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm hungry because I didn't eat breakfast.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: ㅡ irregular: 배고프다 → 배고프어요.  Literally 배(stomach) + 고프다(empty)

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm full because I ate too much.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: ㅡ irregular: 배부르다 → 배부르어요.  Opposite of 배고프다

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm thirsty after exercising.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: ㅡ irregular: 목마르다 → 목마르어요.  목(throat) + 마르다(dry)

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm sleepy because I couldn't sleep last night.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 졸리다 (to feel sleepy) vs 졸다 (to doze off). Related: 졸음, 꾸벅꾸벅.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I have a headache. (My head hurts.)
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: ㅡ irregular: 아프다 → 아프어요.  Used for all pain types: 배가 아프다, 다리가 아프다

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: The weather is nice today.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 좋다 (adjective: something is good) vs 좋아하다 (verb: to like actively). Essential distinction in Korean.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I dislike spicy food.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 싫다 (adjective: dislike) vs 싫어하다 (verb: active dislike). Opposite of 좋다. Collocations: 싫어서, 싫은데.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: This drama is really fun/interesting.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Literally 재미(interest/fun) + 있다(exist). Opposite: 재미없다. Collocations: 재미있는 영화, 재미있게.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: That movie was boring.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Literally 재미(fun) + 없다(not exist). Opposite of 재미있다. Related: 지루하다, 심심하다.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm excited because I'm going on a trip tomorrow!
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Casual, energetic excitement (child-like). 신나는 음악 (upbeat music). Related: 흥분하다, 들뜨다.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm frustrated because we can't communicate.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Physical (stuffy room) or emotional (frustrated). Very common in Korean. Related: 터질 것 같다, 갑갑하다.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: This sofa is really comfortable.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Physical comfort or ease of mind. 편안하다 is formal. Opposite: 불편하다. Collocations: 편한 옷, 편한 마음.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: This chair is very uncomfortable.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 불(不-not) + 편(comfortable). Physical discomfort or situational inconvenience. Related: 거슬리다, 성가시다.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm satisfied with this result.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 만 appears in 만족(satisfaction), 만나다(to meet). 족 appears in 만족(satisfaction).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example: 그때 더 열심히 공부할 걸 후회해요.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I regret not studying harder back then.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 후 appears in 후회(regret), 후손(descendants). 회 appears in 회색(gray), 회의(meeting), 회사(company).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I miss my hometown.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: ㅂ irregular: 그립 → 그어요.  Used for people, places, or times you long for

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm upset because my friend said something mean to me.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 속(inside/heart) + 상하다(to go bad). Literally 'the inside is hurt.' Related: 마음이 상하다, 서러움.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I feel wronged because I got scolded even though I didn't do it.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: A distinctly Korean emotion — feeling unfairly blamed. No perfect English equivalent. Related: 분하다, 통분하다.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm excited because it's my first date.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Fluttery, anticipatory excitement (often romantic). 설렘 (noun). Related: 두근거리다, 설레임.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I feel proud and fulfilled after finishing the project.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Warm accomplishment/fulfillment. More personal than 자랑스럽다. Related: 뿌듯함, 뿌듯이.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).english: to be annoyed / to be irritated
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: The bus isn't coming, so I'm annoyed.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Very commonly used minor irritation. 짜증(noun). 짜증을 내다 (to express annoyance at someone). Related: 열받다.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).english: to be flustered / to be embarrassed
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I was flustered because I was suddenly asked a question.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Caught off guard feeling. 당황스럽다 (flustering/embarrassing as adjective). Related: 어리둥절하다, 쩔쩔매다.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).english: to feel hurt / to feel let down / disappointed
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I feel hurt because my friend canceled our plans.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Distinctly Korean: gentle hurt from someone close. Sadness, not anger. Related: 섭섭하다, 서러움.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).english: to feel relieved / to be at ease
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I was relieved because the test results were good.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 안 appears in 안타깝다(regrettable), 안전(safety). 심 appears in 의심하다(suspect), 심장(heart).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).english: to be bored / to be tedious
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example: 이 영화 너무 지루해요. 다른 거 볼까요?
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: This movie is so boring. Shall we watch something else?
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Boredom from tedious content. 지루한 수업 (boring class). Opposite: 재미있다. Related: 지겹다.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).english: to feel refreshed / to be fresh
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: The morning air is refreshing. I feel good.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 상 appears in 상쾌하다(refreshed), 상황(situation). 쾌 appears in 상쾌하다(refreshed).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).english: to be depressed / to feel gloomy
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: When it rains, I get gloomy.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 우 appears in 우울하다(gloomy), 우산(umbrella), 우승(champion). 울 appears in 우울하다(gloomy), 울다(to cry).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).english: to be excited / to be worked up
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: The concert is tomorrow, so I'm so excited!
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 흥 appears in 흥분하다(excited), 흥미(interest). 분 appears in 분홍(pink), 분위기(atmosphere), 분석(analysis).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).english: to be jealous / to feel jealousy
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I get jealous when my boyfriend talks to other girls.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 질 appears in 질리다(sick of), 질문(question), 질서(order). 투 appears in 질투하다(jealous).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).english: to be grateful / to be thankful
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm really grateful that you helped me.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 감 appears in 감동(emotion/moved), 감사(thanks), 감각(sense).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).english: to be absurd / to be bewildered / ridiculous
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example: 그 사람이 한 말이 너무 황당해요.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: What that person said is so absurd.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Something so ridiculous you don't know how to react. 황당한 상황 (absurd situation). Related: 어이없다.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).english: to feel empty / to feel something is missing
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: Now that my friend has left, my heart feels empty.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Distinctly Korean: emotional or physical emptiness. 허전한 마음 (empty heart). Related: 텅빈, 허허로운.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).english: to feel reassured / to feel full and satisfied
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I ate a lot, so I feel full and satisfied.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Two meanings: physically satisfied (eating) or emotionally secure. 든든한 사람 (dependable person). Related: 든든함.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).english: to bluff / to exaggerate / to lie (slang)
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: Don't bluff! Tell me the truth.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Casual slang for exaggerating/lying. 뻥 (noun: a fib). 뻥이야! (That's a lie!). Used among friends.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I had a mental meltdown when I saw the test results.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Slang: 멘탈(mental) + 붕괴(collapse). 멘붕이 오다 (to have a mental breakdown). Used casually, not clinically.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: You can speak confidently.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Unapologetically confident attitude. 당당히 (confidently as adverb). Related: 자신감, 당찬 목소리.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I was doubtful at first, but it was true.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 의심 (noun: suspicion). 의심이 가다 (to become suspicious). Related: 의심의 여지, 의심 많은.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I really respect my parents.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 존 appears in 존경하다(respect), 존재(existence). 경 appears in 존경하다(respect), 경험(experience), 경제(economy).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: Don't ignore what I'm saying.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 무시 (noun: disregard). Can imply looking down on someone. 무시당하다 (to be ignored/disrespected). Related: 무시당한.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I don't want to receive pity.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 동 appears in 동정하다(pity), 동료(colleague), 동의(agreement). 정 appears in 동정하다(pity), 정보(information), 정신(mind).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).english: to be sick of; to be fed up
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm sick of it because it's the same menu every day.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Very colloquial. 질리도록 (until you're sick of it). 물리다 is synonym. Related: 지겨워하다.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I've gotten used to life in Korea now.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 익숙해지다 (to become familiar). Opposite: 낯설다. -에 익숙하다 (to be used to something). Related: 익숙함.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example: 처음 가는 곳이라 모든 게 낯설어요.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: Everything feels unfamiliar because it's my first time here.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 낯(face/appearance) + 설다. Opposite: 익숙하다. 낯선 사람 (stranger). Related: 낯설음.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I fell in front of people and it was embarrassing.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 민 appears in 민망하다(awkward), 민간(private). 망 appears in 민망하다(awkward), 망원경(telescope).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I feel deflated because the exam was cancelled.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Emptiness after anticipation. When preparation was for nothing. Related: 김이 빠지다, 맥이 풀리다.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: I'm anxious while waiting for the results.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Nervous restlessness. Stronger than 긴장되다. 초조하게 기다리다 (to wait anxiously). Related: 안절부절못하다.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: Hearing that news, I really feel sorry about it.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Sympathetic sadness for others' misfortune. Very commonly used. 안타깝게도 (unfortunately). Related: 통탄스럽다.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: The answer is a bit vague.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Very common in daily Korean. 애매한 상황 (ambiguous situation). 애매모호하다 (even more vague). Related: 모호하다.

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: This problem is too complicated.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: 복 appears in 복잡하다(complicated), 행복(happiness), 복원(restoration). 잡 appears in 복잡하다(complicated), 잡다(to catch).

감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).example_en: It was a simpler problem than I thought.
감정 & 상태 (Emotions & States).notes: Opposite of 복잡하다. 단순히 (simply as adverb). Can mean 'simple-minded' depending on context. Related: 간단하다.

색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).notes: ㅎ irregular: 빨갛 → 빨개요.

색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).example_en: The sky is really blue today.
색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).notes: ㅎ irregular: 파랗 → 파래요.

색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).example_en: The leaves turn yellow in autumn.
색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).notes: ㅎ irregular: 노랗 → 노래요.

색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).example_en: It snowed so the world is white.
색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).notes: ㅎ irregular: 하얗 → 하얘요.
ㅎ irregular: 까맣 → 까매요.
초 appears in 초록(green), 초대(invitation), 초콜릿(chocolate). 록 appears in 초록(green), 록(rock). 색 appears in 색깔(color), 색칠(painting), 색상(hue).
주 appears in 주황(orange), 주의(attention), 주인(owner). 황 appears in 주황(orange), 황금(gold), 황제(emperor). 색 appears in 색깔(color), 색칠(painting), 색상(hue).
보 appears in 보라(purple), 보람(worth), 보험(insurance). 라 appears in 보라(purple), 라디오(radio). 색 appears in 색깔(color), 색칠(painting), 색상(hue).
분 appears in 분홍(pink), 분위기(atmosphere), 분석(analysis). 홍 appears in 분홍(pink), 홍보(publicity), 홍수(flood). 색 appears in 색깔(color), 색칠(painting), 색상(hue).
회 appears in 회색(gray), 회의(meeting), 회사(company). 색 appears in 색깔(color), 색칠(painting), 색상(hue).
색 appears in 색깔(color), 색칠(painting), 색상(hue).
크 appears in 크다(big), 크기(size).

색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).example_en: These clothes are too small for me.
색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).notes: 작 appears in 작다(small), 작품(work), 작성(writing).
많은 (modifier). 많이 (adverb: a lot). Collocations: 많은 사람, 너무 많다. Opposite: 적다.
적은 (modifier). Opposite: 많다. Don't confuse with 적다 (to write down). Related: 적은양, 드물다.
길 appears in 길다(long), 길(road), 길이(length).
짧 appears in 짧다(short), 짧아지다(to shorten).
넓 appears in 넓다(wide), 넓음(width).
좁 appears in 좁다(narrow), 좁아지다(to narrow).
높 appears in 높다(high), 높이(height).

색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).example_en: This table is a bit low.
색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).notes: 낮 appears in 낮다(low), 낮(daytime).
ㅂ irregular: 무겁 → 무거워요.
ㅂ irregular: 가볍 → 가벼워요.
빠 appears in 빠르다(fast), 빨간(red). 르 appears in 빠르다(fast), 느리다(slow).
느 appears in 느리다(slow), 느낌(feeling). 리 appears in 느리다(slow), 리더(leader).
ㅂ irregular: 새롭 → 새로워요.
오래된 (modifier). Only for things, NOT people's age (나이가 많다 for people). Related: 낡다, 묵은.
좋 appears in 좋다(good), 좋아하다(to like).
ㅡ irregular: 나쁘 → 나빠요. 나쁜 (modifier). Opposite: 좋다. Related: 악한, 좋지않은.
ㅡ irregular: 예쁘 → 예뻐요. For women, children, things. 아름답다 (more literary). Related: 곱다, 아리따운.
Past form 잘생겼어요 is standard. Literally 'well-formed' (잘+생기다). Related: 멋있다, 호남.
ㅂ irregular: 귀엽 → 귀여워요.
깨 appears in 깨끗하다(clean), 깨닫다(to realize). 끗 appears in 깨끗하다(clean).

색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).example_en: Your hands are dirty. Wash them.
색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).notes: ㅂ irregular: 더럽 → 더러워요.
밝은 (modifier: 밝은 미래). For light, color, mood. Opposite: 어둡다. Related: 환한, 휘황하다.
ㅂ irregular: 어둡 → 어두워요.
따 appears in 따뜻하다(warm). 뜻 appears in 따뜻하다(warm), 뜻(meaning).
ㅂ irregular: 차갑 → 차가워요.
ㅂ irregular: 뜨겁 → 뜨거워요.
ㅂ irregular: 부드럽 → 부드러워요.
Onomatopoeic origin. Figuratively: 딱딱한 분위기 (stiff atmosphere). Related: 팔팔하다, 뻣뻣한.
ㅂ irregular: 쉽 → 쉬워요.
ㅂ irregular: 어렵 → 어려워요.
Sino-Korean 重(중-heavy) + 要(요-necessary). 중요한 (modifier: 중요한 약속). Related: 필수적이다, 중대하다.

색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).example_en: That road is dangerous at night.
색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).notes: Sino-Korean 危(위-danger) + 險(험-risk). 위험한 (modifier). Opposite: 안전하다. Related: 위태로운, 험하다.
연한 + color name (연한 분홍색). Opposite: 진하다 (dark/deep). Related: 옅은, 담담한.
For colors (진한 빨간색 = deep red) and flavors (진한 맛). Related: 짙다, 농축된.
화 appears in 화나다(angry), 화합(harmony), 화해(reconciliation).
Opposite of 화려하다; positive connotation (tasteful). Related: 담백한, 소박한.
For objects and health. 몸이 튼튼하다 (physically strong). Related: 견고한, 우악한.
약 appears in 약하다(weak), 약(medicine), 약속(promise).
ㅂ irregular: 두껍 → 두꺼워요.
Opposite of 두껍다. Pronunciation: [얄따]. Related: 얇은, 가늘다.

색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).example_en: This cake is moist and delicious.
색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).notes: Positive nuance. Used for skin (피부가 촉촉하다) and food texture. Related: 축축한, 촉촉이.

색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).example_en: I like this chicken because it's crispy.
색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).notes: 바삭바삭 (very crispy, doubled). Ideal texture for fried food. Related: 아삭아삭, 씹어먹는.

색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).example_en: I ate a sweet strawberry cake.
색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).notes: More poetic than 달다. Figuratively: 달콤한 말 (sweet words). Related: 감미로운, 다복한.

색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).example_en: The sesame oil smells nutty and savory.
색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).notes: Uniquely Korean flavor concept; no exact English equivalent. Essential for food description. Related: 고소로운.
Sino-Korean 新(신-new) + 鮮(선-fresh). Used for food, air, and ideas. Related: 상큼한, 싱싱한.

색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).example_en: The milk has gone bad. Throw it away.
색깔 & 형용사 (Colors & Adjectives).notes: 상 appears in 상쾌하다(refreshed), 상황(situation).
익 appears in 익숙하다(familiar), 익명(anonymous).
날(raw) + 것(thing). 날생선 (raw fish), 날달걀 (raw egg). Related: 생것, 미익의.
당 appears in 당황하다(flustered), 당신(you).
분 appears in 분홍(pink), 분위기(atmosphere), 분석(analysis).
부 appears in 부끄럽다(embarrassed), 부모(parents), 부분(part). 족 appears in 만족(satisfaction).
완(complete) + 벽(wall, flawless). 완벽하게 (adverb: perfectly). Related: 흠잡을데없는, 무결한.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: What are you doing?
I go to school.
My friend comes to my house.
Did you eat lunch?
I drink a lot of water.
I slept well last night.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to wake up, to get up
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I wake up at 7 every morning.
I wash my hands before eating.
What are you going to wear today?
I take off my shoes when I enter the house.
I go out wearing sneakers.
May I sit here?
I wait standing in line.
I walk in the park.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: ㄷ irregular: 걷 → 걸어요. Polite: 걸어요.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: The children are running in the playground.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to see, to watch, to look
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I watch movies on weekends.
I listen to music often.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).notes: ㄷ irregular: 듣 → 들어요. Polite: 들어요.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to speak, to say, to tell
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Please speak slowly.
I'm reading an interesting book these days.
I write in my diary every day.
I make a cake on weekends.
I buy fruit at the market.
This store sells bread.
I give a present to my friend.
I received a birthday present.
Please open the window.
Please close the door.
Please turn on the light.
I turn off the light before sleeping.
I'm looking for my wallet.
Please wait here for a moment.
I'm meeting a friend tomorrow.
I call my mom.
I study Korean every day.
I work at a company.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to rest, to take a break
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I rest at home on weekends.
Class starts at 9 o'clock.
Class ends at 12 o'clock.
I arrived at the airport.
The train is departing soon.
Let's hang out together on the weekend.
I like Korean food.
I hate lies.
I need an umbrella.
Do you know that person?
I don't know much about that.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to exist, to have, to be (at a place)
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Do you have time?

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to not exist, to not have
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I don't have money.
I live in Seoul.
I'm learning Korean.
I teach English.
Please help me.
I borrow books from the library.
I lost my phone.
I cry when I watch sad movies.
I laughed because that story was funny.
I clean my room every weekend.
I need to do laundry.
I cook at home.
I drive to work every day.
I go by subway.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to get off, to go down
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I get off at the next station.
It takes 30 minutes from home to school.
I changed to a new phone.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to fix, to repair, to correct
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I fixed the computer.
Please throw the ball. I'll catch it.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to catch / to grab / to hold
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I raised my hand to catch a taxi.
Please push the door. It won't open.
You have to pull this door to open it.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to lift / to carry / to hold up
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example: 이 상자 좀 들어 주세요. 무거워요.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Please lift this box for me. It's heavy.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to put down / to let go / to release
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Please put your bag down here.
Do you put sugar in your coffee?

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to take out / to remove / to subtract
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example: 양파를 빼 주세요. 양파를 못 먹어요.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Please leave out the onion. I can't eat onion.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to fall / to drop / to run out
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I dropped my phone and the screen cracked.
The elevator was broken, so I went up by stairs.
To take the subway, go down the stairs.
When I go inside the house, I wash my hands.
I'll go outside for a bit. I'll be right back.
When will you come back to Korea?
I need to take the child to the hospital.
Can I bring a friend to the party?
I sent an email. Please check it.
I called a taxi. It will come soon.
Please answer the teacher's question.
Please explain this word in a simple way.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to promise / to make an appointment
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: We promised to meet tomorrow.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example: 여행 준비 다 했어요? 내일 출발이에요.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Are you all done preparing for the trip? We depart tomorrow.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to organize / to tidy up / to sort out
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I need to tidy up my room. It's too messy.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to confirm / to check / to verify
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: Please confirm the reservation.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to reserve / to book / to make a reservation
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I reserved a restaurant. We can go at 7.
I divide the cake into four pieces.
Collecting stamps is my hobby.
Please fill the cup with water.
I need to empty the trash can.
I lock the door before going out.
I hid the present inside the closet.
I discovered a new great restaurant!
Please choose just one from the menu.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example: 아직 뭘 할지 결정 못 했어요.
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I haven't decided what to do yet.
I couldn't hold back my laughter.
Never give up!
I finally succeeded on the exam!
I failed on the first try.

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to make an effort; to try hard
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: I make an effort to study Korean every day.
Happy birthday!
I'm always cheering for you!

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to lie; to tell a lie
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: You shouldn't lie!
I was worried because you suddenly disappeared.
You finally showed up!

자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).english: to increase; to grow; to improve
자주 쓰는 동사 (Common Verbs).example_en: My Korean skills have improved a lot.
The number of customers has decreased a lot lately.
Our team won 3 to 1!
We lost by a narrow margin.
It ended in a 2-2 tie.
I graduated from university last year.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: The weather is very nice today.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean intensifier. Family: 많이 (much), 조금 (a little). Neutral register used in speech and writing.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: This issue is very important.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 每 appears in 매일, 매년. 月 appears in 월급, 월요일.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: This food is really delicious.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native verb 정하다 (to determine) + adverb form. Polite and natural; 정말요? (Really?) expresses surprise.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It's really fun!
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native word meaning 'the real thing' as a noun. Casual register; 진짜요? = For real? Family: 진정 (true/authentic).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Please help me (a bit).
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Short form of 조금 (a little). Softens imperative requests; 좀 비켜 주세요 (move over please) sounds gentler than without it.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Please give me just a little water.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean word; full formal version of 좀. Collocations: 조금씩 (little by little), 조금 더 (a bit more).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Please eat a lot. (Enjoy your meal.)
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Adverb from adjective 많다 (many/much). Common phrase: 많이 드세요 (enjoy your meal). Family: 많음 (abundance).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Come quickly!
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: From adjective 빠르다 (fast). Cultural: 빨리빨리 (hurry-hurry) is a famous Korean cultural concept of rushing.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Please speak slowly.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean adverb. Essential phrase for language learners. Opposite: 빨리 (quickly).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: You speak Korean well.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: From adjective 잘(?) meaning good. Collocations: 잘 먹겠습니다 (said before meals), 잘 지내요? (How are you?), 잘 모르다 (don't know well).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I can't go today.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Placed before verbs for negation. Semantic difference: 못 = can't (incapable), 안 = don't/won't. Related: 못하다 (to be bad at).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I don't eat meat.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Placed before verbs for negation. With 하다 verbs: 공부 안 해요 (not 안 공부해요). Opposite of 못.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: See you again!
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native word with multiple uses. Can link items: 사과, 또 바나나 (apples and also bananas). Slight overlap with 다시.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Please say it one more time.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Implies repeating/restarting. Subtle difference from 또: 다시 = repeat; 또 = additional/recurring.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I already ate.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Neutral statement of fact without surprise. Compare with 벌써 (already, with surprise). Collocations: 이미 늦었어요 (it's already too late).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It's not finished yet.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Usage: 아직 + positive = still doing; 아직 + negative = not yet. Related: 아직도 (still, with emphasis).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It's already 12 o'clock?
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Carries emotional tone of surprise. Unlike 이미, expresses that something happened sooner than expected.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I'm always grateful.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 恒 appears in 항상, 항구적. 常 appears in 상식, 일상.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I come to this restaurant often.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native word. Frequency spectrum: 항상 > 자주 > 가끔 > 드물게. Common in daily conversation.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: What time do you usually wake up?
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 普 appears in 보편, 보통. 通 appears in 통일, 통과.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I sometimes watch movies.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Less frequent than 자주. Related: 가끔씩 (occasionally, emphasized form).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I absolutely never lie.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 絕 appears in 절대, 절연. 對 appears in 대척, 대항.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I don't understand at all.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 全 appears in 전체, 전국, 전부.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: The homework is almost done.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 거 appears in 거리.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It will probably rain tomorrow.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Often paired with -(으)ㄹ 거예요 for future guessing. Less certain than 확실히 (certainly).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: You must come! / Make sure to come!
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Also means 'tightly' in physical sense. For emphasis in requests/promises: 꼭 해야 돼요 (you definitely have to do it).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Wash your hands first.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Collocations: 먼저 가세요 (go first, polite), 먼저 말했어요 (said it before).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I'll call you later.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 나중 = later time (noun). Opposite: 먼저. Collocations: 나중에 봐요 (see you later).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Do you want to eat lunch together?
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 같이 is casual/spoken; 함께 is formal/written. Both very common. Family: 함께하다 (to do together).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I travel alone.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Related: 혼자서 (emphasizes solitude). Collocations: 혼자 살다 (to live alone). Opposite: 같이/함께.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I'll go right away.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Multiple uses: time (immediately), location (right here). Collocations: 바로 여기 (right here), 바로 그거예요 (that's exactly it).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It suddenly rained.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: The exam is finally over!
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Implies waiting/anticipation with positive nuance. Collocations: 드디어 왔어요 (it finally came).

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I drank coffee, and then took a walk.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It rained. So I took an umbrella.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I want to go. But I don't have time.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It's difficult but fun.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).english: then, if so, in that case
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example: 배고프다고요? 그러면 같이 밥 먹으러 가요.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: You're hungry? Then let's go eat together.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It's hard. But still, I won't give up.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I couldn't go. Because I was sick.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It takes roughly about thirty minutes.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 大 appears in 대사, 대학. 略 appears in 약간, 약속.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: What time exactly are we meeting?
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 正 appears in 정답, 정상. 確 appears in 확실, 확인.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I clearly put it here but it's gone.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 分 appears in 분별, 분석. 明 appears in 명백, 명확.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Can you definitely finish it by tomorrow?
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 確 appears in 확인, 확대. 實 appears in 실제, 현실.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Honestly speaking, it's a bit expensive.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example: 한국 음식 중에 특히 불고기를 좋아해요.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Among Korean foods, I especially like bulgogi.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 特 appears in 특별, 특수. 異 appears in 이상, 차이.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: On weekends I mostly rest at home.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 主 appears in 주인, 주장, 주말.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: In the end, it rained so we couldn't go.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 結 appears in 결론, 결과. 局 appears in 국장, 상황.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: At last, the exam is over!
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example: 서울은 비가 왔어요. 한편, 부산은 맑았어요.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It rained in Seoul. Meanwhile, it was sunny in Busan.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 一 appears in 일단, 일시. 片 appears in 조각, 편.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).english: moreover / besides / on top of that
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It's raining, and on top of that, it's windy.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example: 비가 많이 와요. 따라서 우산을 가져가세요.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: It's raining a lot. Therefore, take an umbrella.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).english: that is / namely / in other words
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Tomorrow, that is, Monday, we start.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 卽 appears in 즉각, 즉시.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example: 과일을 좋아해요. 예를 들면, 사과나 딸기요.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I like fruit. For example, apples or strawberries.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Sino-Korean: 例 (example) + 들다 (give). Shortened to 예를 들어 in speech.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example: 형은 키가 커요. 반면에 저는 작아요.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: My older brother is tall. On the other hand, I'm short.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 反 appears in 반대, 반역. 面 appears in 면접, 면적.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: I was worried, but it was actually fun instead.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Indicates opposite of what was expected; a surprising contrast.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Anyway, we have to do it.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean with casual tone. Used to dismiss previous discussion and move on.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Of course I'll help!
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 勿 appears in 무엇. 論 appears in 논문, 논쟁.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: Actually, I don't really know either.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: 事 appears in 사건, 사업. 實 appears in 실제, 현실.

자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).example_en: In any case, good work.
자주 쓰는 부사 & 접속사 (Adverbs & Conjunctions).notes: Native Korean. Similar to 어쨌든 but slightly more casual; wraps up a discussion definitively.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example: 우리 집에 개가 한 마리 있어요.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: We have one dog at our house.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Counter: 마리 (for animals). Diminutive: 강아지 (puppy). Related: 개짓다 (to bark), 개밥 (dog food).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The cat is sleeping on the sofa.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Casual: 냥이. Onomatopoeia: 야옹 (meow). Collocations: 고양이 귀 (cat ears/shape).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: A bird is singing on top of the tree.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native word (also means 'new' in other contexts). Species: 참새 (sparrow), 독수리 (eagle).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I caught a fish in the river.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Literally: 물 (water) + 고기 (meat). 생선 refers to fish as food at market. Counter: 마리.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The rabbit is eating a carrot.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Folklore: 달토끼 (moon rabbit) makes rice cakes. Collocations: 토끼처럼 빠르다 (fast as a rabbit).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example: 산에서 곰을 보면 절대 뛰면 안 돼요.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: If you see a bear on the mountain, you must never run.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Sino-Korean mythology: 단군신화 (Dangun myth). Colloquial: slow or clumsy person.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Long ago, tigers lived in the mountains.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Symbol of Korea. Proverb: 호랑이도 제 말 하면 온다 (speak of the devil). Zodiac animal.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: They say the lion is the king of animals.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native word. Not to confuse with 사자 (四字, four characters in 사자성어). Collocations: 사자 수컷 (male lion).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: An elephant's nose (trunk) is really long.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Related to 코 (nose). Native formation. Collocations: 코끼리 등 (elephant's back).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The monkey eats bananas up in the tree.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Zodiac animal: 원숭이띠 (year of monkey). Collocations: 원숭이처럼 재빠르다 (agile as monkey).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Many people are afraid of snakes.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native word. Zodiac animal. Species: 독사 (venomous snake). Metaphor: treacherous person.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The turtle walks slowly.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Base form: 거북 + diminutive suffix 이. Folk tale: 토끼와 거북이 (tortoise and hare). Slow symbol.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I saw a mouse in the kitchen!
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: First zodiac animal: 쥐띠. Specific: 생쥐 (house mouse). Related: 쥐약 (rat poison).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I tried riding a horse on Jeju Island.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Homophone: 말 (speech/words). Context matters. Related: 경마 (horse racing), 말 키우다 (raise horses).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: If you go to the countryside, there are many cows.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Premium: 한우 (Korean beef cattle). Food: 소고기 (beef). Zodiac: 소띠 (year of ox).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The pig is playing in the mud.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Food: 돼지고기 (pork). Culture: dreaming of pig = lucky omen (wealth). Zodiac: 돼지띠.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The chicken crowed in the morning.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Meat: 닭고기 (chicken). Fried: 치킨 (Korean fried chicken). Silent ㄹ before consonants.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Ducks are swimming in the park pond.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Meat: 오리고기 (duck). Sound: 꽥꽥 (quack). Popular Korean dish.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example: 잠이 안 올 때 양을 세요.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: When you can't sleep, count sheep.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Polysemy: also means 'amount' or 'Western' (洋). Meat: 양고기 (lamb/mutton). Zodiac: 양띠.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: In spring, many pretty butterflies fly around.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Related: 나비넥타이 (bow tie, butterfly necktie). Poetic symbol in Korean literature.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Bees collect honey from flowers.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Polysemy: also means 'punishment'. Specific: 꿀벌 (honeybee). Related: 벌집 (beehive).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The ants are walking in a line.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Idiom: 개미처럼 일하다 (work like an ant = work very hard). Collocations: 개미떼 (swarm of ants).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The spider is spinning a web.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Related: 거미줄 (spider web). Pronunciation caution: similar to 거북이. Collocations: 거미집 (spider's nest).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: In summer, there are too many mosquitoes.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Verb: 모기에 물리다 (to be bitten by mosquito). Related: 모기향 (mosquito-repellent incense).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I'm resting under a tree.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Also means 'wood' (material). Related: 나뭇잎 (tree leaf, ㅅ liaison). Collocations: 나무를 심다 (plant a tree).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I gave flowers as a gift to my girlfriend.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Counter: 송이 (for flowers). Related: 꽃집 (flower shop), 꽃다발 (bouquet). ㅊ silent before consonants.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The children are running and playing on the grass.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Polysemy: also means 'glue'. Related: 풀밭 (grassy field), 풀 뽑다 (pull grass). Also: 풀숲 (grass grove).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: In autumn, the leaves turn red.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native word. Compounds: 나뭇잎 (tree leaf), 잎사귀 (literary form). Counter: 장.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I went to the mountain with friends on the weekend.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Activity: 등산 (hiking/mountain climbing), very popular in Korea. Related: 산책 (walk).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I rode a bicycle along the Han River.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Famous: 한강 (Han River, Seoul). Related: 강변 (riverside), 강물 (river water). Collocations: 강을 건너다.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I want to go to the sea in summer.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Culturally important (peninsula). Related: 해변 (beach), 바닷가 (seaside).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The lake is really beautiful.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Sino-Korean: 湖 (lake) + 水 (water). Related: 호숫가 (lakeside). Counter for lakes.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Jeju Island is the largest island in Korea.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Korea has 3,000+ islands. Related: 무인도 (uninhabited island), 섬사람 (islander).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: It's hard to find water in the desert.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Sino-Korean: 沙 (sand) + 漠 (vast). Related: 사막화 (desertification). Uncommon in Korea.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Walking in the forest makes you feel better.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Activity: 산림욕 (forest bathing), wellness trend. Related: 숲속 (inside forest).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The sky is really clear today.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Related: 하늘색 (sky blue), 하늘하늘 (fluttery). Poetic: can mean heaven.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The ground is wet because it rained.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Also means land/territory. Related: 땅속 (underground), 땅콩 (peanut, ground nut).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I picked up a pretty stone from the river.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Also means first birthday celebration (돌잔치). Related: 돌담 (stone wall), 돌탑 (stone pagoda).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The children are making a castle out of sand.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Related: 모래사장 (sandy beach), 모래시계 (hourglass, sand clock).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The waves are really high today.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Sino-Korean origin. Activity: 파도타기 (surfing). Collocations: 파도 소리 (sound of waves).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: You can hear the refreshing sound of water from the waterfall.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Sino-Korean: 瀑 (waterfall) + 布 (spread). Famous: Cheonjeyeon Falls. Related: 폭포수 (waterfall water).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: A rainbow appeared after the rain stopped.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean unique formation. Related: 무지개색 (rainbow colors), 무지갯빛 (iridescent).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I bought one red rose.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Counter: 송이 (for flowers). Related: 장미꽃 (emphasizes flower part). Color: 빨간 장미 (red rose).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Sunflowers always look toward the sun.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Poetic etymology: 해 (sun) + 바라기 (one who gazes at). Metaphor in Korean poetry.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Let's go see cherry blossoms in spring.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Season: spring viewing. Cultural: 벚꽃 놀이 (cherry blossom festival). Famous: Yeouido Park.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The autumn leaves on the mountain are really pretty.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Season: fall. Activity: 단풍놀이 (autumn leaf viewing). Famous spots: Seoraksan, Naejangsan.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The children want to go to the zoo.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Sino-Korean: 動 (animal) + 物 (thing) + 園 (garden). Seoul Grand Park has a major zoo.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I watched a dolphin show at the aquarium.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Sino-Korean: 水 (water) + 族 (group) + 館 (building). Also: 아쿠아리움 (loanword).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I want to raise a pet.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Modern preference: 반려동물 (companion animal). Reflects attitude shift toward pet care. Related: 애완동물 용품 (pet supplies).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I walk the puppy every evening.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Causative form: 산책 (walk) + 시키다 (to make someone do). Related: 산책 나가다 (go for a walk).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: An eagle is flying high in the sky.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Large bird of prey. Variant: 대머리 독수리 (bald eagle). Symbolizes strength and freedom.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: A crow is sitting on the power line.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Culture: morning crow = bad omen in superstition. Sound: 까악까악 (caw). Related: 까마귀 무리.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Sparrows are eating bread crumbs.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Very common in Korea. Proverb: 참새가 방앗간을 그냥 지나랴 (sparrow can't resist grain mill/temptation).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: There are too many pigeons in the park.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Common urban bird. 평화의 비둘기 (dove of peace). Many find urban pigeons a nuisance.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The parrot imitates human speech.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Sino-Korean: 鸚鵡. Idiom: 앵무새처럼 따라 하다 (to repeat like a parrot). Collocations: 앵무새 말 (parrot speech).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Penguins can't fly but they swim well.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Loanword from English. Very popular as cute character in Korean media and merchandise.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I saw a whale in the sea near Jeju Island.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Proverb: 고래 싸움에 새우 등 터진다 (when whales fight, shrimp's back breaks = innocents suffer). Jeju whale tours.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: The dolphin jumped out of the water.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Etymology: 돌 (spinning) + 고래 (whale). Jeju known for wild dolphin sightings. Collocations: 돌고래 쇼 (dolphin show).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Sharks are scary but cool animals.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Cultural: 아기상어 (Baby Shark) viral song. Collocations: 상어지느러미 (shark fin).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: An octopus has eight legs.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Polysemy: also means 'written language' (文語). Delicacy: 산낙지 (live small octopus). Counter: 마리.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I caught a small crab at the beach.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Premium: 꽃게 (blue crab). Dish: 간장게장 (soy marinated crab) called 밥도둑 (rice thief).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: I've seen a deer on the mountain.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Related: 사슴벌레 (stag beetle). Korea tourism: Nara Deer Park is popular Japan destination.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Foxes are very smart animals.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Mythology: 구미호 (nine-tailed fox) shapeshifter. Idiom: 여우같다 (crafty/sly).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Wolves appear often in old stories.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Compound: 늑대인간 (werewolf). Idiom: 양의 탈을 쓴 늑대 (wolf in sheep's clothing).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: A squirrel is eating acorns up in the tree.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Idiom: 다람쥐 챗바퀴 돌듯 (like squirrel wheel = repetitive busy life). Related: 도토리 (acorn).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Bats are animals that are active at night.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Folklore: seen as two-faced. Idiom: 박쥐같다 (indecisive/double-faced). Nocturnal.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Dragonflies fly around a lot in autumn.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Polysemy: also means 'sleeping spot/bed'. Red dragonfly 고추잠자리 is autumn symbol in Korea.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: A ladybug landed on my hand.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Compound: 무당 (shaman) + 벌레 (insect). Bright colors resemble shaman outfit. Considered lucky.

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example: 비가 온 후에 지렁이가 땅 위로 나와요.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: Earthworms come above ground after it rains.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Proverb: 지렁이도 밟으면 꿈틀한다 (even earthworm writhes when stepped on = even meek have limits).

동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).example_en: You need to be careful of jellyfish at the beach in summer.
동물 & 자연 (Animals & Nature).notes: Native Korean. Verb: 해파리에 쏘이다 (to be stung by jellyfish). Beaches post summer warnings.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Today's Korean class was fun.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 授 appears in 수여, 전수. 業 appears in 업무, 사업.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I haven't finished all my homework yet.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 宿 appears in 숙박, 숙소. 題 appears in 문제, 주제.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example: 다음 주에 시험이 있어서 공부해야 돼요.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I have to study because there's an exam next week.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 試 appears in 시도, 시험. 驗 appears in 검증, 검사.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: My grades went up a lot this semester.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 成 appears in 성장, 성공. 績 appears in 실적, 성과.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Please open your textbook to page 30.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 教 appears in 교실, 교장. 科 appears in 과목, 과학. 書 appears in 서류, 서명.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I wrote down the important content in my notebook.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Also called 노트 (loanword, more common now). Traditional term: 공책. Counter: 권 (for books/notebooks).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example: 연필로 먼저 쓰고 나중에 펜으로 써요.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: First write with pencil, then later write with pen.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 鉛 (lead) + 筆 (writing tool). Related: 색연필 (colored pencil). Counter: 자루.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Can you lend me just one ballpoint pen?
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Loanword: 볼 (ball) + 펜 (pen). Formal writing uses 검정 볼펜 (black ballpoint). Counter: 자루.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I erased the wrong part with an eraser.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: From verb 지우다 (erase) + -개 (tool suffix). For pen: 화이트 (white-out). Counter: 개.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: The teacher is writing on the blackboard.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Modern schools use 화이트보드 (whiteboard) or 스마트보드 (smart board). Culture: chalkboards less common now.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Please cut the paper with scissors.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Same word as scissors in 가위바위보 (rock-paper-scissors). Related: 가위눌림 (sleep paralysis).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I'm gluing the paper with glue.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Homophone: 풀 (grass). Type: 딱풀 (glue stick, most common). Related: 풀칠하다 (to glue).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Please give me just one sheet of paper.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Counter: 장 (sheet). Traditional: 한지 (Korean paper, very durable). Related: 종이접기 (paper folding).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I do my homework on the computer.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Loanword from English. 노트북 = laptop (not notebook). PC방 = Korean internet cafe (hugely popular).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I printed the report with the printer.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Verbs: 출력하다/인쇄하다 (to print). 프린트 means both printer and printout.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: The classroom is on the third floor.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Sino-Korean: 教 (teach) + 室 (room). Korean schools number from 1 (not ground floor).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: If you review every day, your skills improve.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 復 appears in 회복, 복원. 習 appears in 학습, 습관.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I previewed the content we'll learn tomorrow.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 豫 appears in 준비, 예비. 習 appears in 학습, 습관.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I have to give a presentation in class tomorrow.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 發 appears in 발병, 발전. 表 appears in 표시, 표현.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example: 오늘 수업에서 환경 문제에 대해 토론했어요.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: We discussed environmental issues in class today.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Native Korean

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: If you have a question, please raise your hand.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 質 appears in 품질, 자질. 問 appears in 문제, 문의.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I couldn't answer the teacher's question.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 對 appears in 대척, 대항. 答 appears in 정답, 답변.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: The teacher explained the grammar easily for us.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 說 appears in 설득, 학설. 明 appears in 명백, 명확.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Can you understand this sentence?
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: More natural: 이해가 되다. Related: 이해력 (comprehension ability). Native speaker usage pattern.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Memorizing Chinese characters is the hardest.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Native Korean

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Please translate this sentence into English.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 翻 appears in 번역, 뒤집다. 譯 appears in 번역, 통역.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I practice pronunciation every day.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 練 appears in 연습, 단련. 習 appears in 습관, 학습.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: The answer is wrong. Please try again.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Often confused with 다르다 (to be different). 틀리다 = error; 다르다 = simply different.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Yes, that's correct! It's the right answer.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Also means 'to fit' or 'to be hit'. 맞아요 is most common Korean affirmation response.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: My test score is 90 points.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 點 appears in 점검, 점유. 數 appears in 수학, 수치.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I'm really happy that I passed the exam.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 合 appears in 합의, 합동. 格 appears in 기준, 자격.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Unfortunately, I failed this time.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 不 appears in 부정, 불가능. 合 appears in 합의, 합동. 格 appears in 기준, 자격.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I graduate from university next year.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 卒 appears in 졸업. 業 appears in 사업, 업무.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I enroll in elementary school in March.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 入 appears in 입장, 입구. 學 appears in 학교, 학생.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I'm taking 5 subjects this semester.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 學 appears in 학교, 학생. 期 appears in 기간, 시기.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 科 appears in 과학, 교과. 目 appears in 목표, 목록.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I'm solving math problems.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 數 appears in 숫자, 점수. 學 appears in 학교, 학생.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Doing science experiments is fun.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 科 appears in 과목, 교과. 學 appears in 학교, 학생.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 歷 appears in 역사, 경력. 史 appears in 역사, 사관.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 英 appears in 영국, 영어. 語 appears in 언어, 한국어.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: We sang songs during music class.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 音 appears in 음성, 소리. 樂 appears in 음악, 즐거움.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 美 appears in 아름다움, 미모. 術 appears in 기술, 방법.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: We played soccer during P.E. class.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 體 appears in 신체, 체형. 育 appears in 교육, 양육.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I take notes diligently during class.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Verb: 필기하다 (take notes). Related: 필기시험 (written exam), 필기구 (writing instruments).

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Memorizing English words is hard.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: More formal than 외우다. Sino-Korean: 暗 (dark) + 記 (record) = learning by heart.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Korean grammar is very different from English.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 文 appears in 문학, 문화. 法 appears in 법칙, 규칙.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I memorize 10 words a day.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 單 appears in 단순, 개별. 語 appears in 언어, 한국어.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: My Korean pronunciation has improved a lot.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 發 appears in 발전, 발병. 音 appears in 음성, 음악.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: The listening test is the hardest.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Native Korean verb form

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I want to practice speaking a lot.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Native Korean verb form

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: My reading speed is gradually getting faster.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Native Korean verb form

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I haven't finished my writing homework yet.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Native Korean verb form

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I take Korean conversation classes every week.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 會 appears in 모임, 회의. 話 appears in 대화, 말씀.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: This problem is too difficult.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 文 appears in 문학, 문화. 題 appears in 주제, 문제.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: They give a prize if you get the correct answer.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 正 appears in 정상, 정확. 答 appears in 대답, 답변.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I make a wrong-answer notebook and review it.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 誤 appears in 실수, 오류. 答 appears in 정답, 대답.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: The teacher handed out the model answers.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Students compare their answers to 모범답안 after exams. Important for learning.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: If you cheat on the test, you get a zero.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: Konglish from 'cunning.' Formal: 부정행위 (academic dishonesty). Serious in Korea.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I received a scholarship because my grades were good.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 獎 appears in 상을. 學 appears in 학교, 학생. 金 appears in 돈, 금메달.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: Korean university tuition is very expensive.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 登 appears in 등급, 등산. 錄 appears in 기록, 녹음. 金 appears in 돈, 금메달.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I received a business degree from university.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 學 appears in 학교, 학생. 位 appears in 지위, 위치.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: I'm researching Korean in a master's program.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 碩 appears in 큼, 훌륭함. 士 appears in 학자, 지식인.

학교 & 공부 (School & Study).example_en: It took 5 years to get my doctorate.
학교 & 공부 (School & Study).notes: 博 appears in 넓음, 광범위. 士 appears in 학자, 지식인.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I go to work at 8 a.m. every morning.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 出 appears in 출장, 출발. 勤 appears in 근무, 업무.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I left work early today.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 退 appears in 퇴직, 물러남. 勤 appears in 근무, 출근.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: There's a meeting at 2 p.m.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 會 appears in 모임, 회화. 議 appears in 의견, 의논.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I have to submit the report by tomorrow.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 報 appears in 보도, 보상. 告 appears in 선언, 고지. 書 appears in 책, 서류.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Please check your email.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English. Collocations: 이메일을 보내다 (send), 이메일을 받다 (receive).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: A phone call came from the client.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Native Korean. Collocations: 전화하다 (make call), 전화를 받다 (answer phone).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: We exchange business cards when meeting for the first time.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 名 (name) + 銜 (title). Cultural: give/receive with both hands in Korean business.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The salary comes in on the 25th.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 月 appears in 월요일, 매월. 給 appears in 급여, 제공.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I received a bonus at the end of the year.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'bonus'

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm going to take vacation next month.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 休 appears in 쉬다, 휴식. 暇 appears in 한가로움, 한가지.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm going on a business trip to Busan next week.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 出 appears in 출발, 출근. 張 appears in 펼침, 장력.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example: 이번 주에 야근을 세 번이나 했어요.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I worked overtime three times this week.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 夜 appears in 밤, 야간. 勤 appears in 근무, 근로.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I eat lunch together with my colleagues.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 同 appears in 같음, 동료. 僚 appears in 동료, 일원.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I showed the report to my boss.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 上 appears in 위, 상급. 司 appears in 관리, 회사.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I entrusted the work to my subordinate.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 部 appears in 부서, 부분. 下 appears in 아래, 하위.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The team leader led the meeting.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 長 appears in 장관, 회장.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The CEO is on a business trip today.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 社 appears in 회사, 사회. 長 appears in 길다, 대표.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm nervous because I have an interview tomorrow.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 面 appears in 얼굴, 면적. 接 appears in 만남, 접촉.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I submitted my resume online.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 履 appears in 밟다, 이력. 歷 appears in 역사, 경력. 書 appears in 책, 서류.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I got a job after graduating from university.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 就 appears in 임명, 따르다. 職 appears in 직업, 직책.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: My father is retiring next year.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 退 appears in 물러남, 퇴근. 職 appears in 직업, 업무.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I got promoted by working hard.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 昇 appears in 오르다, 상승. 進 appears in 나아가다, 진행.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I was fired because the company situation was bad.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Native Korean

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I signed the contract.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 契 appears in 계약, 약속. 約 appears in 약속, 생략.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm busy because the deadline is tomorrow.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Native Korean

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: We started a new project.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'project'

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm an office worker.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 會 appears in 모임, 회의. 社 appears in 회사, 사회. 員 appears in 인원, 직원.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: That person is a famous entrepreneur.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 事 appears in 일, 사건. 業 appears in 업무, 사업. 家 appears in 집, 가정.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm working as a freelancer.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'freelancer'

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I worked part-time at a cafe when I was a college student.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I worked as an intern in the summer.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'intern'

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I negotiated my annual salary.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 年 appears in 연도, 연간. 俸 appears in 급여, 봉급.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: This company has good benefits.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 福 appears in 행운, 복리. 祉 appears in 행복, 복지.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Working hours are from 9 to 6.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 勤 appears in 근로, 일. 務 appears in 업무, 역무. 時 appears in 시간, 시기. 間 appears in 사이, 간격.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Shall we eat together during lunch break?

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: There's a team dinner this evening.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Work stress has been severe lately.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English. Collocations: 스트레스를 받다 (feel stressed), 스트레스를 풀다 (relieve).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I achieved good results this year.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 成 appears in 이루다, 성공. 果 appears in 결과, 열매.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I achieved this quarter's goal.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 目 appears in 눈, 목표. 標 appears in 표시, 기준.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm organizing the documents.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 書 appears in 책, 서류. 類 appears in 종류, 류.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Please make 10 copies of this document.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 複 appears in 여러, 중복. 寫 appears in 쓰다, 글씨.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Please send the documents by fax.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Still used in many Korean offices, especially government and traditional businesses.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm giving a presentation to the client tomorrow.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Shortened: PT (피티) in office slang. PPT (피피티) = PowerPoint slides.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: We're carrying out the project in cooperation with another team.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 協 appears in 함께, 협력. 力 appears in 힘, 능력.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Competition is fierce in the job market these days.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 競 appears in 경쟁, 겨루다. 爭 appears in 싸움, 다투다.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: If office supplies are running low, tell the general affairs team.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Includes pens, paper, stapler, etc. Related: 문구류 (stationery). Sino-Korean: 事 + 務 + 用 + 品.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The copier broke down, so I requested a repair.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Also: 복합기 (multifunction device: print, scan, fax). Common office equipment issue.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I scan documents with the scanner and send them by email.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English. Verb: 스캔하다 (scan). Often integrated in multifunction machines.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example: 공유 캘린더에 회의 일정을 넣어 주세요.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: Please put the meeting schedule on the shared calendar.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Refers to digital calendars usually. Traditional: 달력 (physical calendar). Very important for scheduling.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: An announcement was posted on the bulletin board.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Also refers to online forums/boards. Related: 게시글 (post). Digital and physical versions common.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I always wear a name tag at work.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 名 (name) + 札 (tag/label). Collocations: 명찰을 달다 (wear name tag). Required at many workplaces.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: They check attendance every morning.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 出 appears in 나오다, 출발. 席 appears in 자리, 좌석.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I was late today because I missed the bus.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 遲 appears in 늦다, 지각. 刻 appears in 새기다, 시각.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I left early because I wasn't feeling well.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 早 appears in 일찍, 아침. 退 appears in 물러남, 퇴근.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I was absent from work today because I was sick.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 缺 appears in 빠지다, 부족. 勤 appears in 근무, 일.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: There's a team workshop next week.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'workshop'

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm attending a marketing seminar this afternoon.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'seminar'

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: We brainstormed for the new project.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'brainstorming'

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The teamwork was really great on this project.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'teamwork'

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The project succeeded thanks to the team leader's leadership.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Loanword from English 'leadership'

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I've grown a lot at this company.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 成 appears in 이루다, 완성. 長 appears in 길다, 자라다.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I was assigned to plan a new product.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 企 appears in 기획, 기도. 劃 appears in 계획, 그림.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: The budget for this project is insufficient.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: 豫 appears in 미리, 준비. 算 appears in 셈, 계산.

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example: 이번 달 매출이 지난달보다 많이 올랐어요.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: This month's sales went up a lot compared to last month.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 賣 (sell) + 出 (out). Related: 매출액 (sales revenue amount), 매출 목표 (sales target).

직장 & 일 (Work & Office).example_en: I'm planning to invest in that company.
직장 & 일 (Work & Office).notes: Sino-Korean: 投 (throw) + 資 (resources). Related: 투자하다 (invest), 투자자 (investor), 주식 투자 (stock investment).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I clean my room every weekend.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 청(靑) appears in 청결(cleanliness), 청년(youth). 소(掃) appears in 청소(cleaning). Native + Sino-Korean verb.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: The weather is nice, so I'm doing laundry.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native verb: 빨(wash clothes) + 래(suffix). Related: 빨래(laundry), 빨래방(laundromat), 세탁하다(dry clean).

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I do the dishes after dinner.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native word. Related: 설거지기(dish soap), 설거지통(dish basin). Common: 설거지를 하다, 식후 설거지.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: Today I'm cooking.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: 要(important) appears in 요청(request), 요구(demand). 理(principle) appears in 물리(physics), 정리(organization). Sino-Korean verb.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I iron my shirt before going to work.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native compound: 다림(iron) + 질(action). Related: 다리미(iron-tool), 다림판(ironing board). Common: 다림질해요.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I sweep the yard with a broom.
집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).notes: Native verb (irregular). Conjugation: 쓸다→쓸어요/쓸었어요. Related: 청소(cleaning), 빗자루(broom). Common: 바닥을 쓸다.

집안일 & 생활 (Housework & Daily Life).example_en: I wipe the table clean.
